intro: Odontonema mazarunensis, commonly known as the Mazarunensis stiltroot, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically Brazil. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its unique, slender, cylindrical roots that grow vertically. The plant produces small, tubular flowers in clusters, typically in shades of purple or pink, which bloom during the warmer months. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for horticultural study due to its adaptability and ornamental value.
